steps.title: Hold the dropper 2 inches (5 cm) from your nail.
steps.content: Hold the dropper 2 inches (5 cm) from your nail. Do this if your cuticle oil uses a dropper to dispense the oil. Other cuticle oil products may use a brush (like nail polish) or a roller to dispense the oil.

steps.title: Apply the oil to each nail.
steps.content: Apply the oil to each nail. Focusing on one hand at a time, squeeze a drop of oil onto each nail. A little oil goes a long way, but don't be afraid to apply liberally and often. Alternatively, use the brush or the roller to dot each nail with oil.

steps.title: Massage the oil into your cuticles.
steps.content: Massage the oil into your cuticles. Make sure to massage it into the sides of your nail, as well as the skin surrounding your nail. Take a minute to massage the oil into your nails to induce blood circulation. Repeat steps one through three on your other hand.

steps.title: Re-apply every two to three hours.
steps.content: Re-apply every two to three hours. It takes around two to three hours for the oil to completely absorb and dry. Or, reapply as often as you need to. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Use the oil after a manicure.
steps.content: Use the oil after a manicure. Cuticle oil is a great way to rehydrate your cuticles after a manicure. The oil will not harm or remove the nail polish. Additionally, cuticle oil is a great way to revamp an old manicure. Just massage the oil over your cuticles and nails to give them a fresh shine. [2] X Research source Do not use it before a manicure. The oil will prevent the nail polish from adhering to your nail. If you do decide to use it before a manicure, then make sure to wipe your nails clean with nail polish remover or alcohol.

steps.title: Apply the oil after you have pushed back your cuticles.
steps.content: Apply the oil after you have pushed back your cuticles . First soften your cuticles by soaking them in water for 10 minutes. Once they are soft, use an orangewood stick or a metal cuticle pusher to push them back. Then massage the cuticle oil into your cuticles. [3] X Research source It is recommended that you do not trim, cut, or remove your cuticles.

steps.title: Put it on whenever you have free time.
steps.content: Put it on whenever you have free time. Apply the oil whenever you are riding the bus or sitting in a taxicab, at your work desk, or on the couch while watching TV, for example. Basically, whenever you have some downtime. [4] X Research source Apply cuticle oil twice a day, or more if you need to.

steps.title: Apply the oil before bedtime.
steps.content: Apply the oil before bedtime. This is a great way to ensure that your cuticles stay hydrated and nourished for the coming day. Just remember to be persistent and consistent to keep your cuticles looking healthy.
